projects.title: Sophia College PR & Social Design
projects.description: Internal communications design and social media strategy for Sophia College
projects.longDescription: As Head of PR at Sophia College (May 2023 – April 2024), I led the design and rollout of internal communications assets, including posters, email visuals, and Instagram content. This work was part of a broader strategy to keep students informed, engaged, and excited about campus events. My goal was to make information instantly clear while keeping the visuals chic and student-friendly. Most of the graphics leaned into a minimal, feminine aesthetic—centered around Sophia's signature peach and green, with splashes of beige and brown tones.
features: Social media content with trending audios

projects.title: Offsuit Boston: Speakeasy Social Media Concept
projects.description: Dark, moody social media concept for a hidden speakeasy behind a downtown coffee shop
projects.longDescription: At Northeastern, I created a social media concept for Offsuit Boston, a hidden speakeasy tucked behind a downtown coffee shop. The brief was to choose an existing business and develop content that captured its brand essence while appealing to potential customers. I leaned into a dark, moody aesthetic to reflect Offsuit's intimate and elusive vibe. The graphics featured cocktail details, bar textures, and shadowy lighting—evoking the speakeasy mystique while still drawing intrigue.

projects.title: Campus Flyers & Poster Design
projects.description: Collection of event posters and promotional materials for campus activities
projects.longDescription: Across my undergrad extracurriculars and now at Northeastern through class projects, I've built a collection of posters and flyers designed for events, awareness campaigns, and campus activations. These range from last-minute club promotions to structured assignment deliverables. Each piece was shaped by its purpose—some loud and playful, others clean and informative. I focused on clarity with character, using bold type, intuitive layouts, and color choices that matched tone and audience.

projects.title: Canada Black Music Archives: Content Concept Deck
projects.description: Visual content deck for preserving and promoting Black musical history
projects.longDescription: At Northeastern, I worked on a content design project for the Canada Black Music Archives (CBMA), an emerging archive based in Toronto dedicated to preserving Black musical history. The organization partnered with our class to help shape a fresh, flexible content deck for social and digital use. Working within a strict brand kit, I explored layered overlays, textured backgrounds, and bold text treatments to bring energy and rhythm to the visual language. Many of the graphics incorporated music elements—vinyls, waveforms, and vintage mic silhouettes—with a retro jazz-inspired vibe running through the entire deck.

projects.title: Short-Form Video & Reels Collection
projects.description: Curated collection of Instagram reels and short-form video content
projects.longDescription: This is a curated set of short-form videos and reels made for Instagram-first audiences. Most are quick, punchy edits crafted with trending audios, timed transitions, and visuals that hook scrollers fast. These videos are built to entertain, engage, and reflect the aesthetic of the brand they represent. I believe short-form video is where the scroll stops and connection begins. Whether it's a brand teaser or an event recap, I create videos that let the vibe speak before the caption does.

projects.title: We Will Lead Africa: Digital Design for Global Visibility
projects.description: Social graphics championing Black leadership across Africa and the diaspora
projects.longDescription: As part of a class project for my Digital Marketing course at Northeastern, I created social graphics for We Will Lead Africa, an organization that champions Black leadership across the continent and diaspora. These designs put faces front and center. Using bold, modern typography and a color palette inspired by African heritage, I aimed to give the movement a global-ready visual identity. Text became the bridge between culture and contemporary impact—making space for strong voices to shine, while drawing in international audiences with design that demands attention.
